title: Higher Elevations of Medano Pass Primitive Road Still Closed
message: Medano Pass Primitive Road is currently closed at the 4th creek crossing, 6.4 miles from the southern entrance of the road. This is a backcountry road that does NOT affect travel to the dunes or main use area of the park.

title: Yampa Permit Holders
message: If you have a permit to launch at Deerlodge Park in the next few weeks, please visit the Current Conditions page or contact the river office at 970-374-2468 or DINO_River_Office@nps.gov for information about alternative launches.

title: Record Winter
message: Due to record snowfall and prolonged cold temperatures, projected opening dates for some areas are different from years past. Before planning to venture to areas of the monument beyond the Quarry Area on the Utah side, please visit Current Conditions.

title: Road Closures
message: The park is open to the Visitor Center & Gunnison Point. The rest of South Rim Road, as well as the East Portal and North Rim Roads, are closed for the season. Due to heavy snowfall this year, roads may open later than normal (late April or early May).

title: Pinon Flats Campground Restrooms Closed for Renovations
message: Pinon Flats Campground restrooms are closed until further notice. While the restrooms are undergoing renovations, porta-potties and hand-wash stations will be provided. Outside water faucets are available for use.

title: Visitor Center Closed for Renovations
message: The visitor center is closed to complete interior renovations. Ranger information and the WNPA park store are available in a temporary building located in the visitor center parking lot.

title: Restroom Closures
message: The restrooms at the campground and picnic area will be closed in stages during renovation. The project will run from 3/27 to 4/30/23. Portable toilets are available, and one restroom will remain open while the other is being worked on.

title: Mesa Verde Closures
message: While much of the park is open, Mesa Verde has several safety and project-related closures in place, including the Wetherill Mesa Road, the Chapin Mesa Museum, and Spruce Tree House. Follow the link for more information.

title: Highway 50 Construction
message: Road construction and road closures will begin on Monday, March 6, 2023, for the Highway 50 Little Blue Creek Canyon Improvement Project. The project is located between mileposts 123 and 127, approximately 30 miles east of Montrose, Colorado.

title: US Highway 50 Roadwork
message: Road construction with delays and nightly closures on US Highway 50 between Cimarron and Dillon Pinnacles runs from March 6 to July 31, 2023. The road is open to two-way traffic on weekends and holidays.

title: Black Canyon South Rim Wilderness Permits
message: South Rim inner canyon permits can be obtained day-of-the-trip at the visitor center (because it is off-season), either from a ranger or self-serve. Permits are required for Gunnison, Tomichi, and Warner routes and inner canyon trips; daily limits apply.

title: National Park Service Updates Mask Requirements Following new CDC Guidance
message: In accordance with CDC guidance for counties with low to medium COVID transmission rates, masks are optional in park buildings. In areas CDC identifies as high transmission rates, masks are required in all NPS buildings regardless of vaccination status.

title: Winter Conditions
message: Winter weather is variable at Mesa Verde. Snow is always possible and icy conditions will sometimes close the park road. All activities depend on road, trail, and weather conditions. Check https://www.facebook.com/mesaverdenps/ for current conditions.

title: Major Construction Project has Begun at the Fall River Entrance to Rocky Mountain National Park
message: Fall River Entrance to RMNP is under construction. One lane is open to enter. Visitors are encouraged to avoid the Fall River Entrance and use the Beaver Meadows Entrance via U.S. Hwy 36. Expect wait times at both major east side entrances to RMNP.

title: Visitor Center Hours
message: The Visitor Center area is open from 9am until 4:30pm. The Visitor Center, Petrified Forest loop, Ponderosa loop, and parking lot close promptly at 4:30pm. Remaining vehicles subject to $180 fine.

title: Trail Ridge Road is closed to through traffic for the season
message: Trail Ridge Road is currently closed at Many Parks Curve on the east side of RMNP and at the Colorado River Trailhead on the west side.

title: No Water Available at Black Canyon
message: Temperatures are now well below freezing, so all water at the park has been turned off for the winter. Make sure to bring drinking water and any other water needs.

title: Campground Closure
message: A and C loops in the South Rim Campground are closed for the season. B loop is open, and electricity is on. All water is turned off for the winter.

title: Ranger Talks Temporarily Resumed
message: Ranger talks at Sand Creek Massacre NHS have resumed. The site is open Thursday - Monday from 9am to 4pm and talk take place at 10am and 2pm.

title: COVID-19 Masking Advisory
message: Larimer, Boulder, and Grand Counties continue to switch between High, Medium, and Low community transmission levels for COVID-19. Masks are advised for Beaver Meadows VC, Moraine Park Discovery Center, Fall River VC, Alpine VC, and shuttle buses.

title: Credit Card Only
message: Entrance fee and pass purchases will need to be made with a credit or debit card. The monument will not be processing cash transactions. Apple, Google, and Samsung Pay are accepted.

title: Park Store Operations
message: The WNPA Park Store is open inside the Visitor Contact Station at the historic site outside of Eads. The occupancy limit is 4 people at a time. Masks are optional.

title: Temporary Closure - Cutthroat Unit
message: Due to physical security concerns related to the access of the Cutthroat Castle Unit, the unit is closed to public access. Cutthroat Castle is a remote unit of Hovenweep and is not connected to the Square Tower Group structures.

title: COVID-19 Mask Requirement
message: Consistent with CDC's COVID-19 Community Level tool, visitors to Sand Creek Massacre NHS are encouraged but not required to wear a mask inside all park buildings.

title: COVID-19 Mask Requirement - Currently Optional
message: Consistent with CDC guidance masking is currently optional due to low transmission rates in the surrounding area. If this should move to a high level, masks will be required.
